# Getting Started
### 1. Clone or Download the repo
```bash
git clone https://github.com/raghav-konk/QuizAppChatGPT.git
```

### 2. Open index.html in a browser (or) Run a local Development server

```bash
python3 -m http.server
```
### 3. Start Selecting!
Pick answers, click Get Answers, and Copy to clipboard to paste back into ChatGPT or other LLMs

---
# Customization
* Edit the number of questions or options directly in index.html.
 
* Change fonts by modifying the <link> tags in the <head> or using Google Fonts.
 
* Replace sounds in /assets/sounds/ with your own. 
* Adjust animations in style.css to fit your desired aesthetic.

### How to use this this app?


1. ğŸ™‹Ask your LLM with a prompt to create a Quiz (You can specify the number, say 10 questions) on a topic you just studied.
1. For each question you see on your screen, Select the corresponding answer.
1. ğŸ« After finishing the quiz, Click on "Copy" button to copy your answers to clipboard.
1. ğŸ°Paste the answers in your LLM as prompt for the quiz it just generated.
1. â³It will grade the answers and give you the result.
1. ğŸ“¢I have added sounds too, just to keep the project alive and interesting. So Tune your volume slider.
1. ğŸ‘ŒOh, 1 more thing. This quiz also supports Multiple Answer Logic too. Meaning One question having Option A and B etc. <br>
1. ğŸ‘ŒAdded Vibration too for mobile devices. Did that at May 29, 2025 11:22PM IST.
